body_html:
ranges cannot be specified with tensors, they have to be values.... so you must do

pad = 8
width = tf.shape(vector_loss,)[2]
start, end = pad, (width - pad ).eval()
vector_loss = vector_loss[:,:,start:end, :]

Soon, we will release negative index support which will not ease the restriction that the end range cannot be a tensor, but it will allow

vector_loss[:,:,pad:-pad,:]
body_text:
ranges cannot be specified with tensors, they have to be values.... so you must do
pad = 8
width = tf.shape(vector_loss,)[2]
start, end = pad, (width - pad ).eval()
vector_loss = vector_loss[:,:,start:end, :]

Soon, we will release negative index support which will not ease the restriction that the end range cannot be a tensor, but it will allow
vector_loss[:,:,pad:-pad,:]
body:
ranges cannot be specified with tensors, they have to be values.... so you must do

```
pad = 8
width = tf.shape(vector_loss,)[2]
start, end = pad, (width - pad ).eval()
vector_loss = vector_loss[:,:,start:end, :]
```

Soon, we will release negative index support which will not ease the restriction that the end range cannot be a tensor, but it will allow

`vector_loss[:,:,pad:-pad,:]
`
